title: No, Benjamin Netanyahu hasn’t made any comments asking Hindus to become ‘Parashuram’
subtitle: ﻿Netanyahu hasn’t made these comments asking Hindus to become ‘Parashuram’. Information from no credible source was found which confirms these comments
author: factly.in
vclaim:
An image with a photo of Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu with an accompanying message is being shared widely on Facebook. The message is in Hindi and its English translation is- “Proofs about the existence of Ram will be sought from Hindus until one stays calm like Ram, the day they turn to be aggressive like Parashuram, even the children of Babar would say Jai Sri Ram”. Let’s try to analyze the claim made in the post.



Claim: Benjamin Netanyahu: “Proofs about the existence of Ram will be sought from Hindus until one stays calm like Ram, the day they turn to be aggressive like Parashuram, even the children of Babar would say Jai Sri Ram”. Fact: Netanyahu hasn’t made these comments. Information from no credible source was found which confirms that the comments were made by him. Hence the claim made in the post is FALSE.

When searched on Google with keywords ‘Benjamin Netanyahu about Hindus being sought for the proofs of ram’s existence’, no relevant information was obtained in the search results about Netanyahu making those statements.



If Netanyahu had really made such statements, they would have been reported by all the major newspapers and channels in India. But no news agency has reported anything about Netanyahu making those comments. So, false statements are being attributed to Netanyahu.



To conclude, Benjamin Netanyahu hasn’t made those comments. False statements are being attributed to him.
